main.name: Dre Graham
main.description: Welcome to my website! I am an aspiring Cloud Solutions Architect/Engineer and am using this website to showcase my talent. Feel free to click around and have fun!
main.bio: I'm currently pursuing a B.S. in Cloud Computing from Western Governors University when I'm not traveling with my wife or hiking with my 3 dogs. I have a passion for cloud technologies and aspire to become a Cloud Architect/Engineer.
main.contactmessage: Want to schedule a consultation or have a question? Reach out to me via email or by using the contact form below.

education.description: Completed hands-on coursework in Cloud architecture, systems administration, networking, and cybersecurity. Gained experience with AWS and Azure, Linux and Windows server management, resource automation and scaling, and implementing DevOps practices including CI/CD and IaC. Applied ITIL and Agile methodologies in projects involving secure, scalable cloud deployments, database management, and system automation.

work.title: Technical Escalations Specialist, L3
work.description: As a Technical Escalations Specialist L3, I lead complex technical escalations and serve as the highest tier of support. Building upon my experience with cloud monitoring tools such as Kibana, CloudWatch, DynamoDB, and SUMO, I architect comprehensive solutions for enterprise-scale challenges. I mentor L1-L2 specialists while collaborating directly with engineering teams to resolve critical system issues and develop permanent fixes. My expertise spans advanced SQL optimization, complex database architecture, and cloud-based monitoring systems, allowing me to drive technical innovation and process improvements across the entire Support organization.

projects.title: Cloud Database Project
projects.category: A cloud database project that I worked on during my studies at WGU

projects.title: AI Project
projects.category: A project I used AI to complete.

projects.title: Multi-Cloud Deployment
projects.category: A cloud deployment project that includes multiple cloud providers.
